title: Conversable
html:
Conversable

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Conversable Inc.
Founded2015; 4 years ago (2015) in Austin, Texas, United States
FoundersBen Lamm
Andrew Busey
Headquarters815-A Brazos Street, Suite 318,
Austin

United States
Number of locations
2
Area served
Worldwide
Key people
Ben Lamm CEO
Andrew Busey CPO
Number of employees
39 (2018[1])
Websiteconversable.com

Conversable is a SaaS based Artificial Intelligence (AI) powered conversational platform, headquartered in Austin, Texas. It allows customers to create intelligent, automated response flows through conversations in any messaging channel or voice platforms.[2][3] It has offices in Austin and Dallas.

Some of companies using Conversable platform includes Budweiser[4], Wingstop[5], Pizza Hut[6], T.G.I. Friday's][7], Sam’s Club[8], Shake Shack[9], CES[10], Whole Foods[11] and 7-Eleven[12].

Contents

  • 1 History
  • 2 Overview
  • 3 Partnership
  • 4 References
  • 5 External links

History[edit]

In 2015, Conversable Inc. was founded by Ben Lamm, founder and CEO of digital creative design studio Chaotic Moon Studios, which was acquired by Accenture, and Andrew Busey, former CEO & co-founder of social game company Challenge Games Inc., which was acquired by Zynga.[13] It received funding of $2 million from angel investors.[14]

In March 2017, Conversable launched a new product called AQUA (Answer Questions Using AI), which is a business intelligence (BI) platform.[15][16][4]

In 2018, Conversable was acquired by LivePerson to "help LivePerson continue to accelerate its goal of providing conversational commerce products to customers," according to CEO Robert Locascio.[17]

Overview[edit]

It helps companies to deliver on-demand content, customer self-service, and conversational commerce via messaging channel and voice applications.[13][14]

Partnership[edit]

The company is partnered with Phobio in January, 2018.[18] It is also partnered with Olo,[19], Hinduja Global Solutions,[20] Booz Allen Hamilton,[21], Ernst & Young,[16], Mindtree,[22] WPP [23] and Pactera.[24]
